qas.question: What did the Greeks call Bahrain?
Where was the central point of pearl trading?
Which of Alexanders commanders were the first to visit Bahrain?
Alexander planned to colonized the eastern bank of the Persian Gulf with what ethnicity of colonist?
Tylos worshipped Zeus in the form of what Arabian sun-god?

context: In Arabia, <a1_0>Bahrain<a1_0/>, which was referred to by the Greeks as <a0_0>Tylos<a0_0/>, the centre of pearl trading, when Nearchus came to discover it serving under Alexander the Great. The Greek admiral <a2_0>Nearchus<a2_0/> is believed to have been the first of Alexander's commanders to visit these islands. It is not known whether Bahrain was part of the Seleucid Empire, although the archaeological site at Qalat Al Bahrain has been proposed as a Seleucid base in the Persian Gulf. Alexander had planned to settle the eastern shores of the Persian Gulf with <a3_0>Greek<a3_0/> colonists, and although it is not clear that this happened on the scale he envisaged, Tylos was very much part of the Hellenised world: the language of the upper classes was Greek (although Aramaic was in everyday use), while Zeus was worshipped in the form of the Arabian sun-god <a4_0>Shams<a4_0/>. Tylos even became the site of Greek athletic contests.
